item.title: 查莫斯说，中国总理的澳大利亚之行是 "意义重大 "的一步
item.description: 财政部长吉姆-查莫斯（Jim Chalmers）周六表示，中国国务院总理李强七年多来首次访问澳大利亚，是两国关系 "真正重要的一步"。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang’s first visit to Australia in more than seven years is a “really significant step” for the two nations’ relationship, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said on Saturday.】

item.title: 新加坡撞船事故后正在清理溢油
item.description: 新加坡港口当局正在处理周五在巴西班让码头一艘船与另一艘船相撞后发生的漏油事件。【原文：Singapore’s port authorities are dealing with an oil spill that occurred after one vessel collided with another at the Pasir Panjang Terminal on Friday.】

item.title: 现代汽车将在印度首次公开募股中出售 1.422 亿股股票
item.description: 根据一份红线招股说明书草案，现代汽车公司将在其印度子公司的首次公开募股中出售 1.422 亿股股票。【原文：Hyundai Motor Co. will sell 142.2 million shares in an initial public offering of its Indian unit, according to a draft red herring prospectus.】

item.title: 全球首个比特币 ETF 将在澳大利亚交易所上市
item.description: 直接投资于比特币的交易所交易基金将首次在澳大利亚主要股票市场上市，这是继类似产品在美国和香港开始交易之后，又一波此类产品的上市热潮。【原文：An exchange-traded fund investing directly in Bitcoin will list on Australia’s main stock market for the first time, kicking off another wave of such listings after similar products began trading in the US and Hong Kong.】

item.title: 澳大利亚新南威尔士州将提高外国购房者关税
item.description: 澳大利亚新南威尔士州将对在这个人口最多的州购房的海外买家提高一些关税，因为立法者希望解决人们记忆中最严重的住房危机。【原文：Australia’s New South Wales will raise some duties on overseas buyers of homes in the country’s most populous state as lawmakers look to address the worst housing crisis in living memory.】

item.title: 自门板爆炸以来，波音公司举报人向联邦航空局提供的线索激增
item.description: 美国联邦航空管理局（Federal Aviation Administration）与彭博社（Bloomberg News）共享的数据显示，今年前五个月，该机构收到的波音公司（Boeing Co.【原文：The Federal Aviation Administration received more than 11 times as many Boeing Co. whistleblower reports in the first five months of this year compared to all of 2023, according to data the agency shared with Bloomberg News.】

item.title: 马克龙的选举赌注再次给欧洲带来脱欧噩梦
item.description: 埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）决定在法国举行紧急大选，这让欧洲官员们回想起英国脱欧。【原文：Emmanuel Macron’s decision to call a snap election in France is giving European officials flashbacks to Brexit.】

item.title: 中国高端品牌不再受股票投资者青睐
item.description: 面对经济放缓，中国曾经强大的购物者已变成不愿花钱的人，这种转变对高端品牌相关股票来说尤其痛苦。【原文：China’s once-mighty shoppers have turned into reluctant spenders in the face of an economic slowdown, a shift that’s proving particularly painful for stocks related to premium brands.】

item.title: 利润前景乐观，高盛上调 S&P 500 目标价
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists have boosted their year-end target for the S&P 500 Index for a third time, reflecting Wall Street’s optimistic outlook for earnings growth and the US economy.】

item.title: 货币交易员准备迎接美联储会议后的 "交易量杀手 "之夏
item.description: 据期权交易商称，希望未来几个月在央行多次加息举措的背景下带来货币波动性爆炸的投资者要失望了。【原文：Investors hoping the coming months would bring an explosion of currency volatility on the back of multiple central bank interest rate moves are in for disappointment, according to option traders.】

item.title: 监狱电话公司 ViaPath 完成 14.5 亿美元再融资
item.description: 据知情人士透露，为囚犯提供电话和通信服务的 ViaPath Technologies 公司即将完成近 15 亿美元的再融资。【原文：ViaPath Technologies, a company that provides phone and communications services to prisoners, is closing in on a nearly $1.5 billion refinancing, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 领导美国证券交易委员会的投资银行家威廉-唐纳森逝世，享年 93 岁
item.description: 威廉-唐纳森（William Donaldson）去世，他是华尔街投资银行 Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette 的创始人，曾在 2003 年至 2005 年美国证券交易委员会打击企业不法行为期间主持过分裂的美国证券交易委员会。享年 93 岁。【原文：William Donaldson, a founder of Wall Street investment bank Donaldson Lufkin & Jenrette who presided over a divided US Securities and Exchange Commission during its crackdown on corporate misdeeds from 2003 to 2005, has died. He was 93.】

item.title: 买入美国是全球交易者寻求安全的集结号
item.description: 由于国内政治不稳、经济不景气，国际投资者正进一步挤入美国市场这个拥挤的交易市场。【原文：Stung at home by fraught politics and flat economies, international investors are squeezing themselves further into the crowded trade that is American markets.】

item.title: 租赁公司 Sonder 获得运营帮助，缩减业务范围
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，短租公司 Sonder Holdings Inc 正在与 AlixPartners LLP 合作，寻求运营方面的帮助。【原文：Short-term rental company Sonder Holdings Inc is working with AlixPartners LLP for operational help, according to people familiar with the situation, who asked not to be identified discussing a private matter.】

item.title: 纽约一所拥有 140 年历史的学院评级被降至垃圾级
item.description: 霍顿大学是纽约州西部的一所文科学校，成立于 1883 年，其评级被 S&P Global Ratings 下调为垃圾级。【原文：Houghton University, a liberal arts school in Western New York established in 1883, saw its rating downgraded into junk status by S&P Global Ratings.】

item.title: BMO 表示，随着利率下降和收入增加，加拿大的住房可负担性将得到改善
item.description: 加拿大最大的银行之一表示，住房负担能力有望逐步改善，但还不足以使其接近大流行前的水平。【原文：One of Canada’s biggest banks says housing affordability is poised to gradually get better — but not enough to bring it close to pre-pandemic levels.】

item.title: 必和必拓铜矿工人接受工资提议，缓解智利劳资紧张关系
item.description: 必和必拓集团（BHP Group）智利铜矿的工人接受了该公司的最新工资提议，从而结束了占全球供应量约 1%的铜矿紧张的集体谈判进程。【原文：Workers at a BHP Group copper mine in Chile accepted the company’s latest wage offer, putting an end to tense collective bargaining process at an operation accounting for about 1% of global supply.】

item.title: 醉驾被捕威胁泰森继承人在肉类包装巨头的前途
item.description: 约翰-泰森（John R. Tyson）第一次因醉酒被捕后，在家人和泰森食品公司董事会的支持下保住了工作。现在，酒后驾车的指控可能会危及他成为美国最大肉类包装公司高层的道路。【原文：After John R. Tyson’s first arrest involving intoxication, he kept his job with the support of family and Tyson Foods Inc.’s board. Now a drunk-driving charge may jeopardize his path to the top of the largest US meat packer.】

item.title: 巴西基金因政策担忧提升通胀盈亏平衡押注
item.description: 巴西对冲基金押注通胀反弹，因为在上个月的利率决定出现分歧后，央行抑制消费价格的承诺受到质疑。【原文：Brazilian hedge funds are betting on a inflation rebound as the central bank’s commitment to keeping a lid on consumer prices came into question after a divided interest rate decision last month.】

item.title: 阿根廷央行将就债券认沽风险举行会谈
item.description: 据直接了解谈判情况的人士称，阿根廷总统哈维尔-米莱伊（Javier Milei）几天前表示，商业银行是取消外汇管制的主要障碍，而阿根廷央行正在与商业银行高管进行谈判，以减少主权比索债务的看跌期权悬置。【原文：Argentina’s central bank is in talks with executives at commercial banks to reduce the overhang of puts on sovereign peso debts, days after President Javier Milei said they were the main obstacle to lifting exchange controls, according to people with direct knowledge of the negotiations.】

item.title: 刚果 Gecamines 公司威胁要干预钴公司的出售
item.description: 刚果民主共和国的国有矿业公司表示，如果新的所有者想要接管一个关键的采矿许可证，那么对钴生产商 Chemaf Resources Ltd. 的任何收购都需要获得批准。【原文：The Democratic Republic of Congo’s state miner said it will need to approve any acquisition of cobalt producer Chemaf Resources Ltd. if the new owner wants to take over a key mining permit.】

item.title: 巴西国家石油公司老板任命费尔南多-梅尔加雷霍为新首席财务官
item.description: 巴西国有控股石油公司的新任领导人已任命费尔南多-梅尔加雷霍（Fernando Melgarejo）为首席财务官，这是她上个月执掌巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）后的首个重要任命。【原文：The new leader of Brazil’s state-controlled oil company has tapped Fernando Melgarejo to become its chief financial officer, marking her first key appointment since taking the reins at Petrobras last month.】

item.title: 银行测试对 40 亿欧元沃达丰西班牙收购债务的胃口
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，为 Zegona Communication 收购沃达丰集团西班牙业务提供融资的银行正在为约 40 亿欧元（约合 43 亿美元）的债务征集意向，以启动正式的银团程序。【原文：Banks that provided the financing for Zegona Communication’s buyout of Vodafone Group’s Spanish business are canvassing interest for around €4 billion ($4.3 billion) in debt ahead of an official syndication process, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 繁荣与萧条的周期正成为历史： ETF IQ
item.description: 欢迎收看 ETF IQ，这是一份专门报道 12 万亿美元全球 ETF 行业的周报。我是彭博新闻社记者兼主播凯蒂-格雷菲尔德（Katie Greifeld）。【原文：Welcome to ETF IQ, a weekly newsletter dedicated to the $12 trillion global ETF industry. I'm Bloomberg News reporter and anchor Katie Greifeld.】

item.title: 意大利银行批准 ION 的 Prelios 交易，为收购铺平道路
item.description: 意大利银行批准了 ION 集团对 Prelios SpA 公司的收购，为大亨 Andrea Pignataro 收购这家意大利资产管理公司扫清了最后一道障碍。【原文：The Bank of Italy approved ION Group’s purchase of Prelios SpA, clearing the last hurdle to the acquisition of the Italian asset manager by tycoon Andrea Pignataro.】

item.title: 奇数通讯：你可以从加密货币交易者身上学到很多东西
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: 美国东部气温飙升，纽约面临酷暑考验
item.description: 下周，美国东部地区将迎来酷热天气，部分地区气温将升至三位数。【原文：The eastern US is poised to bake next week as scorching weather descends on the region, propelling temperatures into the triple digits in some areas.】

item.title: 道达尔能源、RWE、Orsted 将参加德国风能拍卖会
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，道达尔能源公司（TotalEnergies SE）、RWE AG 和 Orsted A/S 等公司计划参加下一轮德国海上风电拍卖，拍卖将于周一开始。【原文：TotalEnergies SE, RWE AG and Orsted A/S are among companies planning to participate in the next round of a German offshore wind auction, which begins Monday, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 石化仓储公司 LBC 据称将寻求 15 亿欧元的出售计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，LBC Tank Terminals 的所有者正在考虑出售这家散装液体仓储公司，交易价值可能超过 15 亿欧元（16 亿美元）。【原文：LBC Tank Terminals’ owners are considering a sale of the bulk liquid storage company, in a deal that could value it at more than €1.5 billion ($1.6 billion), people with knowledge of the matters said.】

item.title: 作物顶端税为苦苦挣扎的巴西零售商提供了一丝宽慰
item.description: 巴西期待已久的对 50 美元以下的商品征收进口税，将为饱受打击的巴西零售商提供短期缓解，而他们却在长期障碍面前举步维艰。【原文：A long-awaited import tax on purchases up to $50 will offer short-term relief to Brazil’s battered retailers as they stumble over longer-term hurdles.】
